subject: Politics
title: The Political Compass
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Political Compass usable.

hook.text: Left-right misses half the picture. You also need an up-down axis: authoritarian versus libertarian.

buildup.text: The political compass adds a second dimension. Economic left-right meets social authoritarian-libertarian.

discovery.text: Stalin was left-authoritarian. Pinochet was right-authoritarian. Gandhi was left-libertarian.

twist.text: Two dimensions still simplify. Religion, culture, and identity don't fit neatly on any compass.

climax.text: Online compass tests are popular but imperfect. They reduce complex beliefs to a dot on a graph.

punchline.text: Two axes are better than one. But ideology can't be pinned to a dot.

quiz.question: What does the political compass add beyond left-right?
options: An authoritarian-libertarian axis for social views
